meanings.definition: The act of making something universal.
meanings.sent1: The universalization of education ensures that every child has access to learning.
meanings.sent2: The company aimed for the universalization of its products to reach a global audience.
meanings.sent3: The universalization of bedtime rules led to some funny misunderstandings in the household.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a universalization effect, brightening up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The universalization of kindness is a goal we should all strive for.

meanings.definition: The process of extending something to all parts of the world or all people.
meanings.sent1: Global organizations work towards the universalization of healthcare services.
meanings.sent2: The universalization of internet access has connected people from different continents.
meanings.sent3: The universalization of ice cream flavors made choosing a scoop a delightful challenge.
meanings.sent4: His message of peace had a universalization impact, resonating with people worldwide.
meanings.sent5: The universalization of human rights is a crucial step towards equality for all.
